Slider

  • Usage guidelines
  • One handle slider
  • Two handle slider

Usage Guidelines

A slider allows users to choose from a contiguous range of values. This control has a bar that shows the range and a handle that allows the user to adjust the value. In some instances it can have two sliders to represent a to and from range.

Do

  • Use when the user will benefit from instantaneous feedback
  • Use when the value or the range does not have to be precise, and an approximation is good enough.

Don't

  • Use for date or time selection.
  • Use when accessibility is a concern, particularly when designing touch interfaces.
  • Use when the primary context of use is on a mobile device.
  • Use to adjust audio volume.

Styles only

This pattern only provides the styles for the slider component. See the Foundation Docs for an example of how to add the necessary JS to your application. The styles that should be changed by your application JS are added inline below for reference.

One handle slider

Use the one handle slider to allow users to select a single value from a predefined range.

25%
25%

Two handle slider

The two handle slider allows users to specify a minimum and maximum value from a predefined range.

100 200
100 200
